# Rights
## SL-1 Sophont Rights [bold]SL-1-A[/bold] - A ‘sophont’ is categorized as a sentient being that possesses intelligence, consciousness, and adaptability.
- ‘Intelligence’ is the ability to take in new information, understand it, and react.
- ‘Consciousness’ is the ability to be aware of one's own existence and empathize with the existence of others.
- ‘Adaptability’ is the ability to change one's self outside of instruction; to make choices based on the needs of themselves and others.
[bold]SL-1-B[/bold] - Sophonts are given confidentiality in private consultation with their current or reasonably prospective representative.
[bold]SL-1-C[/bold] - Sophonts under custody can request a lawyer to represent them in front of Security and court. Sophonts without a representative can still represent themselves in court.
[bold]SL-1-D[/bold] - Sophonts can accuse any other sophont of any charge through the court process as long as the Magistrate agrees.
## SL-2 Custody Rights [bold]SL-2-A[/bold] - A sophont is under custody if their hands are bound in a restrictive position by a lawful officer, or they are held by a lawful authority.
[bold]SL-2-B[/bold] - A sophont in custody must not unreasonably go hungry or thirsty and must be reasonably mended of all bodily harm and access to clothing.
[bold]SL-2-C[/bold] - A sophont in custody may be interrogated, however can request a lawyer or an individual with a legal license to represent them instead.
[bold]SL-2-D[/bold] - A sophont in custody must reasonably have access to the common radio channel and their shift assigned PDA.
[bold]SL-2-E[/bold] - Reasonable steps must be taken to grant sophonts in custody freedom of limb movement whilst being in custody.
## SL-3 Crewmember vs Sophont [bold]SL-3-A[/bold] - A crewmember has authorisation to remain as an intended part of the station.
[bold]SL-3-B[/bold] - Any sophont can be given crewmember authorization at the HoP’s office.
[bold]SL-3-C[/bold] - Sophonts are protected less under procedure than crewmembers.
## SL-4 Visitation [bold]SL-4-A[/bold] - Visitors must upon approach to the station declare ships classification and their intention of visitation with their IFF on.
[bold]SL-4-B[/bold] - Visitors who have complied and with legitimate intentions must be supplied with temporary crewmember status that will last the duration of the shift.
[bold]SL-4-C[/bold] - Stowaways or refugees are visitors that will be granted temporary crewmember status that will last the duration of the shift.
[bold]SL-4-D[/bold] - Visitors that have demonstrated themself to be hostile or have not followed SL-4-A will be treated as invaders.
